ground_truth: Two men exit through the revolving doors, and the other door opens with Diana emerging. A black Mercedes pulls up, and the motorcycles swarm around the car as Diana gets inside. The Mercedes pulls away, followed by the motorbikes. Video footage shows Diana in a swimming costume in the sea, while the Mercedes is pursued by four motorcyclists, each with photographers riding pillion. Archive footage shows a younger Diana driving away from reporters, and a younger Diana smiling as a photographer snaps her picture. Now, six motorbikes gain on the Mercedes, and on the ski slope, Diana reaches out to mask a photographer's lens. Her hand blocks out the sunlight as a tunnel looms ahead of the Mercedes. Robin lies in bed in a dark room and switches on a bedside lamp. Outside in the darkness, Robin hurriedly approaches Balmoral Castle, rushes down a corridor bustling with people, puts on a black jacket while walking, and rushes up some stairs with a dark-haired woman close behind. Robin stops outside a door while the woman walks up to it. The Queen looks up from her bed and switches on a bedside lamp, with Prince Phillip sitting up beside her. The Queen exits the bedroom, and Robin bows, then turns to Cherie in bed. Charles enters the room where the Queen Mother, Phillip, and The Queen are present, then turns and leaves. Robin approaches a blonde woman, picks up a phone from a nearby desk, and later slowly ascends some stairs while the royal family watches television. Robin enters the room but stays by the door, and Charles stands in a dark room with Steven, rubs his brow, and Steven backs away. BBC video news footage plays as Tony stares at a nearby TV, and on the other end of the phone, Alistair Campbell scribbles on a notepad. The Queen walks down a dimly lit corridor, peeks through a doorway to see Charles talking to Prince William and Prince Harry, and as Charles sees her, he leaves the room, moves to reenter, and she extends her hand briefly before retracting it. Charles stops, his eyes well with tears, and the Queen casts her eyes downward. The Queen walks down a corridor and addresses a footman, then later sits at a desk and writes in a book. Phillip enters a room, stands by the door, holds out a small bottle of pills, and then leaves. People are gathering with shocked and anguished expressions on their faces, and some bury their faces into their hands.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Two gentlemen leave through the revolving gateways, and the other doorway opens with Diana appearing. A black Mercedes arrives, and the motorcycles converge around the automobile as Diana enters. The Mercedes departs, followed by the motorbikes. Video footage displays Diana in a bathing costume in the ocean, while the Mercedes is chased by four motorcyclists, each with photographers riding pillion. Archive footage depicts a younger Diana driving away from journalists, and a younger Diana grinning as a photographer captures her image. Now, six motorbikes gain on the Mercedes, and on the ski slope, Diana extends to cover a photographer's lens. Her hand obscures the sunlight as a tunnel approaches ahead of the Mercedes. Robin reclines in bed in a dim chamber and switches on a bedside light. Outside in the gloom, Robin quickly heads toward Balmoral Castle, dashes down a passage bustling with people, dons a black coat while walking, and rushes up some stairs with a dark-haired female close behind. Robin halts outside a door while the woman walks up to it. The Queen looks up from her bed and switches on a bedside light, with Prince Phillip sitting up beside her. The Queen exits the bedroom, and Robin bows, then turns to Cherie in bed. Charles enters the room where the Queen Mother, Phillip, and The Queen are present, then turns and leaves. The bedroom is exited by The Queen, and Robin is bowed, then Cherie is turned to in bed by him. A blonde woman is approached by Robin, a phone is picked up from a nearby desk by him, and later some stairs are slowly ascended while the royal family watches television. The room is entered by Robin but he stays by the door, and in a dark room, Charles is stood with Steven, his brow is rubbed by him, and Steven is backed away by him. The Queen is walked down a dimly lit corridor, through a doorway a peek is taken to see Charles talking to Prince William and Prince Harry, and as Charles sees her, the room is left by him, he moves to reenter, and her hand is briefly extended by her before it is retracted. Charles stops, tears are welled with by his eyes, and the Queen casts her eyes downward. The Queen is walked down a corridor and a footman is addressed by her, then later at a desk, a book is written in by her. People with shocked and anguished expressions are gathered, and their faces are buried by some into their hands.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Two men exit through revolving doors, and Diana emerges from another. A black Mercedes arrives, surrounded by motorcycles as Diana enters. The car departs, chased by motorbikes. Footage shows Diana in a swim, and the Mercedes pursued by motorcyclists with photographers. Archive clips depict a younger Diana driving from reporters and smiling at a photographer. Six motorbikes now chase the Mercedes; on a ski slope, Diana shields a camera lens. Her hand blocks sunlight as a tunnel nears. Robin, in a dark room, switches on a lamp and hastens to Balmoral Castle, navigating a bustling corridor, donning a black jacket, and ascending stairs with a woman close behind. Robin halts by a door as the woman approaches it. The Queen, in bed, turns on a lamp with Prince Phillip beside her. She leaves the room, and Robin bows and turns to Cherie in bed. Charles enters where the Queen Mother, Phillip, and The Queen are, then departs. Robin approaches a blonde woman, picks up a phone, and later ascends stairs as the royal family watches TV. Robin enters a room and stands by the door as Charles stands with Steven, rubs his brow, and Steven retreats. BBC news footage plays while Tony watches, and Alistair Campbell takes notes on the phone. The Queen, in a dim corridor, peeks at Charles with Prince William and Harry; Charles sees her, exits, and reenters, and she briefly extends her hand. Charles's eyes fill with tears, and the Queen looks downward. She addresses a footman, then writes at a desk. Phillip enters, offers pills, and departs. People gather, appearing shocked and anguished, some burying faces in hands.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Two men leave through revolving doors, as the other door opens for Diana. A black Mercedes arrives, surrounded by motorcycles as Diana enters the car. It departs, pursued by four motorbikes with photographers. Footage shows Diana at sea and on the ski slope, blocking a lens with her hand. As a tunnel approaches, Robin switches on a lamp in a dark room, rushes to Balmoral Castle, and dons a jacket. The Queen turns on a lamp as Prince Phillip sits beside her. She exits, Robin bows, then greets Cherie. Charles visits the Queen Mother, Phillip, and the Queen, then leaves. Robin picks up a phone near a blonde woman, ascends stairs as the royal family watches TV. Robin enters, staying by the door, and Charles stands in darkness with Steven. Tony watches the BBC; Alistair Campbell writes. The Queen sees Charles with William and Harry, extends her hand briefly, and Charles, teary-eyed, pauses. The Queen addresses a footman, writes at a desk, and Phillip offers pills before leaving. People gather with shock and anguish.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Two men make their way out of the building through the revolving doors, and as they do so, another door swings open, revealing Diana as she steps outside. A sleek black Mercedes then arrives at the scene, and a swarm of motorcycles closes in around the vehicle as Diana gracefully climbs inside. The Mercedes smoothly pulls away, with the motorbikes trailing closely behind. Meanwhile, video footage captures Diana wearing a swimming costume as she enjoys a moment in the sea, juxtaposed with the scene of the Mercedes being pursued by a group of four motorcyclists, each one carrying a photographer as a passenger. Archive footage offers glimpses of a younger Diana as she skillfully maneuvers a car to distance herself from reporters, and also of a youthful Diana beaming with a smile as a photographer captures her image. As the narrative continues, six motorbikes close in on the Mercedes. On a snowy ski slope, Diana reaches out in an attempt to obscure a photographer's lens, her hand stretching out to shield her face as sunlight streams through, while a tunnel ominously looms in the path of the Mercedes. In a dimly lit room, Robin lies in bed, and with a flick, he switches on the bedside lamp, casting a soft glow around him. Outside in the darkened surroundings, Robin makes his way swiftly towards Balmoral Castle. He hurries through a corridor teeming with activity, donning a black jacket as he strides purposefully, then races up a flight of stairs with a dark-haired woman close at his side. Robin halts outside a door, while the woman steps up to it. Inside, the Queen, resting in her bed, glances upwards and turns on her bedside lamp, with Prince Phillip sitting up by her side. The Queen leaves her bedroom, and Robin bows respectfully before turning his attention to Cherie, who remains in bed. Charles makes his entrance into a room where the Queen Mother, Phillip, and the Queen are gathered, but then he turns and departs. Robin approaches a blonde woman and retrieves a phone from a nearby desk before gradually ascending a staircase while the royal family is engaged in watching television. Robin enters a room yet chooses to remain by the entrance, as Charles stands in a darkened space with Steven, rubbing his brow, prompting Steven to retreat. BBC news footage plays on a television, catching Tony's intense gaze, while at the other end of the line, Alistair Campbell jots down notes on a notepad. The Queen walks down a corridor bathed in dim light, peeking through a doorway to observe Charles conversing with Prince William and Prince Harry. Upon noticing her, Charles exits the room, and as if to reenter, she extends her hand momentarily but then draws it back. Charles pauses, his eyes welling up with unshed tears, while the Queen lowers her gaze. Continuing down the corridor, the Queen engages in conversation with a footman before eventually seating herself at a desk to write in a book. Phillip enters a room, positioning himself by the door, and extends a small bottle of pills before making his exit. People begin to gather, their faces expressing shock and anguish, with some individuals burying their faces in their hands, overwhelmed by emotion.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: As the scene unfolds, two men make their way out of the grand building by passing through the revolving doors, and just as they do this, another nearby door swings open effortlessly, revealing Diana as she gracefully steps outside into the open air. It is at this moment that a sleek, polished black Mercedes elegantly arrives at the scene, and simultaneously, a swarm of motorcycles rapidly closes in around the vehicle. Diana, with an air of elegance, climbs inside the luxurious vehicle. The Mercedes then proceeds to pull away smoothly, gliding forward with the motorbikes trailing closely behind in a tight formation. Meanwhile, the video footage transitions to capture Diana wearing a stylish swimming costume as she enjoys a serene moment amidst the gentle waves of the sea. This scene is cleverly juxtaposed with the Mercedes being pursued closely by an ensemble of four motorcyclists, each of whom has a photographer perched as a passenger, camera in hand. Archive footage further enriches the visual narrative, offering glimpses of a younger, radiant Diana as she deftly maneuvers a car, aiming to distance herself from the throng of reporters, and also of a youthful Diana beaming warmly with a joyful smile as a photographer snaps her photograph. As the story continues to unfold, six motorbikes close in with precision on the Mercedes. Amidst a snowy, picturesque ski slope, Diana reaches out with intent, attempting to obscure a persistent photographer's lens. Her hand stretches protectively to shield her face from the invasive gaze as sunlight streams through, casting a bright illumination, while a formidable tunnel ominously looms in the Mercedes' path. Meanwhile, in a dimly lit room filled with a quiet stillness, Robin lies in bed, and with a casual flick, he switches on the warm glow of his bedside lamp, casting a soft, comforting light around him. Outside, in the shadowy, darkened surroundings, Robin makes his way swiftly towards the stately Balmoral Castle, quickening his pace. He hurries through a bustling corridor filled with activity, donning a smart black jacket as he strides with determined purpose, then races up a flight of stairs with a dark-haired woman moving swiftly at his side. Pausing for a moment, Robin halts outside a particular door, while the woman steps up to it with confidence. Inside, the Queen, resting in her comfortable bed, glances upwards and turns on her own bedside lamp, illuminating the room, with Prince Phillip sitting up attentively by her side. The Queen makes the decision to leave her bedroom, and as she exits, Robin bows with respectful deference before turning his attention to Cherie, who remains tucked in bed. Charles then steps into another room where the Queen Mother, Phillip, and the Queen are already gathered. However, he soon turns and departs. Robin approaches a blonde woman and retrieves a phone from a nearby desk, then gradually begins ascending a staircase while members of the royal family engage in watching television. Robin enters a different room yet chooses to remain by the entrance, casting a watchful eye. Meanwhile, Charles stands in a dimly lit space with Steven, rubbing his brow in contemplation, prompting Steven to retreat thoughtfully. On a television, BBC news footage plays, capturing Tony's intense and focused gaze, while at the other end of the line, Alistair Campbell diligently jots down notes on a notepad. The Queen moves gracefully down a corridor bathed in dim light, peeking discreetly through a doorway to observe Charles as he converses with Prince William and Prince Harry. Upon noticing her presence, Charles exits the room, and as if preparing to reenter, she extends her hand for a fleeting moment but then draws it back with restraint. Charles pauses, his eyes welling up with unshed tears that threaten to fall, while the Queen lowers her gaze with a sense of gravity. Continuing her walk down the corridor, the Queen engages in a brief conversation with a footman, sharing a few words before eventually seating herself at a desk to write thoughtfully in a book. Phillip enters into a room, positioning himself quietly by the door, and extends a small bottle of pills before making his exit. As the atmosphere shifts, people begin to gather in increasing numbers, their faces expressing a mix of shock and profound anguish, with some individuals overwhelmed by emotion, burying their faces in their hands.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Two men push through the revolving doors, each making their way out carefully as they time their steps with the rotating glass panels, and shortly after, the other door swings open with Diana stepping gracefully into view. Nearby, a sleek black Mercedes approaches, smoothly gliding to a stop as motorcycles surround the car with precise coordination just as Diana settles into the passenger seat. The Mercedes begins to glide forward, seamlessly blending into the flow of traffic, pursued closely by the buzzing motorbikes. Meanwhile, video footage captures a serene scene of Diana in the sea, clad in a swimming costume as she moves with the waves, juxtaposed against the earlier images of the Mercedes relentlessly pursued by four motorcyclists, each carrying photographers perched as pillion riders, cameras poised. Archive footage adds a nostalgic layer, showing a younger Diana deftly maneuvering her car away from a swarm of reporters, and again, a youthful Diana is seen beaming her iconic smile as a photographer captures the moment. Fast forward to the current tense chase, six motorbikes aggressively close in on the Mercedes, adding pressure as the scene shifts to a wintry landscape where Diana is on a ski slope, reaching out with one gloved hand to obscure a photographer’s lens, her hand blocking the light of the sun as the shadow of a tunnel looms ominously ahead for the Mercedes. In a quiet, dimly lit room, Robin lies in bed, reaching over to switch on a bedside lamp, casting light into the dark space. Outside, under the night sky, Robin strides hurriedly towards Balmoral Castle, navigating through a corridor bustling with urgency as people move briskly around him. While walking, he slips on a black jacket, making his way up a flight of stairs with determination, a dark-haired woman keeping pace just behind him. Coming to a stop outside a door, Robin pauses as the woman steps up to it. Inside, the Queen, nestled in bed, is drawn from her thoughts as she switches on her bedside lamp, her gaze following Prince Phillip as he sits up beside her. Exiting the bedroom, the Queen acknowledges Robin with a bow, who then pivots to turn his attention to Cherie lying in bed. Charles enters a room where the Queen Mother, Phillip, and the Queen are gathered, casting a glance across the room before turning to leave. Robin approaches a blonde woman and retrieves a phone from a desk nearby, then later moves with deliberate steps up a staircase, aware of the royal family absorbed in television. As Robin enters the room, he remains by the door, observing Charles who stands in a shadowed room with Steven, rubbing his brow in contemplation as Steven retreats. On the television, BBC video news footage unfolds, capturing Tony's focused gaze as he absorbs the broadcast, while at the other end of the phone line, Alistair Campbell jots down notes with brisk efficiency. As the Queen walks down a dimly lit corridor, she quietly peeks through a doorway, observing Charles in conversation with Prince William and Prince Harry. Her presence prompts Charles to break away, intending to exit, but as he turns back, she extends a hand momentarily before pulling it back, causing Charles to pause, his eyes glistening with unshed tears, the Queen lowering her eyes in shared sorrow. Continuing down the corridor, the Queen speaks briefly to a footman, later settling into her desk to pen thoughts into a book. Phillip enters a room, stands momentarily by the door, extending a small bottle of pills before withdrawing, leaving the Queen to her solitude. Elsewhere, people gather, their faces etched with disbelief and sadness, some unable to contain their emotions as they bury their faces in their hands, a collective scene of shock and despair resonating through the crowd.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
Two men exit through the revolving doors, followed by Diana emerging from another door and entering a black Mercedes. As it departs, motorcycles swarm around, closely pursuing the car. Video footage intersperses, showing Diana in the sea, then a younger Diana driving away from reporters and smiling for a photographer. Six motorbikes gain on the Mercedes; meanwhile, Diana shields a photographer's lens on a ski slope as the car approaches a tunnel. 

Inside a dark room, Robin turns on a lamp, then hurries toward Balmoral Castle, navigates a busy corridor, and ascends stairs alongside a woman. They pause outside a door, where the Queen switches on her lamp, and Prince Phillip sits up. The Queen exits the room, acknowledges Robin with a bow, and glances at Cherie in bed. Following Charles's brief entry and exit in a room with the Queen Mother, Phillip, and the Queen, Robin hands a phone to a nearby blonde woman and later ascends stairs while the royal family watches TV. Robin enters a room, standing by the door, as Charles stands with Steven, who backs away after Charles rubs his brow.

BBC news footage plays as Tony watches TV, and Alistair Campbell takes notes during a phone call. The Queen walks through a dim corridor, observing Charles with Prince William and Prince Harry. Charles notices her, attempts to reenter as she briefly extends her hand, then retracts it. Overcome with emotion, Charles halts, his eyes watering, while the Queen looks down. She continues down the corridor, converses with a footman, then writes at a desk. Phillip enters, offers a small bottle of pills, and departs. People gather with expressions of shock and anguish, some burying their faces in their hands.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Two men exit through the revolving doors of the Ritz Hotel in Paris, a place associated with luxury and opulence, and the other door opens with Diana, Princess of Wales, emerging with her characteristic grace. A black Mercedes, a model often chosen for its security features, pulls up, and the motorcycles, manned by paparazzi eager for exclusive photos, swarm around the car as Diana gets inside. The Mercedes pulls away, followed by the motorbikes known for their relentless pursuit since Diana's publicized separation from Prince Charles. Video footage shows Diana in a swimming costume enjoying the warm Mediterranean sea during one of her charity trips, while the Mercedes is pursued by four motorcyclists, each with photographers riding pillion, reminiscent of the intense media scrutiny she faced. Archive footage shows a younger Diana driving away from reporters, a frequent scenario in her life, and a younger Diana smiling as a photographer snaps her picture, her image captivating the world. Now, six motorbikes gain on the Mercedes, and on the ski slope, Diana reaches out to mask a photographer's lens, a testament to her desire for privacy even in public leisure. Her hand blocks out the sunlight as the Pont de l'Alma Tunnel looms ahead of the Mercedes, a tragic location now etched in history. Robin, an aide to the royal family, lies in bed in a dark room and switches on a bedside lamp after being urgently awakened. Outside in the darkness, Robin hurriedly approaches Balmoral Castle, the royal family's Scottish residence known for its seclusion, rushes down a corridor bustling with people in a state of heightened activity, puts on a black jacket while walking, and rushes up some stairs with a dark-haired woman close behind, likely a fellow staff member. Robin stops outside a door while the woman walks up to it with an urgent message for the Queen. The Queen, known for her steadfastness, looks up from her bed and switches on a bedside lamp, with Prince Phillip, her husband and consort, sitting up beside her. The Queen exits the bedroom, and Robin bows, then turns to Cherie Blair, wife of the Prime Minister, in bed. Charles enters the room where the Queen Mother, Phillip, and The Queen are present, signalling a significant family gathering, then turns and leaves with a heavy heart. Robin approaches a blonde woman, a fellow staffer or confidante, picks up a phone from a nearby desk to relay urgent news, and later slowly ascends some stairs while the royal family watches television, the weight of the news hanging heavy in the air. Robin enters the room but stays by the door, respecting the gravity of the moment, and Charles stands in a dark room with Steven, one of his aides, rubs his brow in distress, and Steven backs away, sensing the prince's need for solitude. BBC video news footage plays as Tony Blair, the Prime Minister, stares at a nearby TV, processing the unfolding tragedy, and on the other end of the phone, Alistair Campbell, his communications director, scribbles on a notepad, preparing to manage the media frenzy. The Queen walks down a dimly lit corridor, peeks through a doorway to see Charles talking to Prince William and Prince Harry, who are coping with the devastating news of their mother's accident, and as Charles sees her, he leaves the room, moves to reenter, and she extends her hand briefly in a gesture of maternal support before retracting it. Charles stops, his eyes well with tears, a rare public display of emotion, and the Queen casts her eyes downward, reflecting the family's collective grief. The Queen walks down a corridor and addresses a footman, issuing quiet instructions for the days ahead, then later sits at a desk and writes in a book, a diary that will capture these historic moments. Phillip enters a room, stands by the door, holds out a small bottle of pills meant to ease the tension, and then leaves to give privacy. People are gathering with shocked and anguished expressions on their faces, a nation in mourning, and some bury their faces into their hands, unable to fully process the magnitude of the loss.

The Mercedes pulls away followed by the motorbikes. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. Robin approaches. a blonde woman picks up a phone from a nearby desk and later slowly ascends some stairs while the royal family watches television. Robin enters the room but stays by the door and Charles stands in a dark room with Steven rubs his brow and Steven backs away. BBC video news footage plays as Tony stares at a nearby TV and on the other end of the phone Alistair Campbell scribbles on a notepad. The Queen walks down a dimly lit corridor peeks through a doorway to see Charles talking to Prince William and Prince Harry and as Charles sees her he leaves the room moves to reenter and she extends her hand briefly before retracting it. Charles stops his eyes well with tears and the Queen casts her eyes downward. The Queen walks down a corridor and addresses a footman then later sits at a desk and writes in a book. Phillip enters a room stands by the door holds out a small bottle of pills and then leaves. People are gathering with shocked and anguished expressions on their faces and some bury their faces into their hands.

In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. The Queen exits the bedroom and Robin bows then turns to Cherie in bed. Charles enters the room where the Queen. Mother Phillip and The Queen are present then turns and leaves. Robin approaches. a blonde woman picks up a phone from a nearby desk and later slowly ascends some stairs while the royal family watches television. Robin enters the room but stays by the door and Charles stands in a dark room with Steven rubs his brow and Steven backs away. BBC video news footage plays as Tony stares at a nearby TV and on the other end of the phone Alistair Campbell scribbles on a notepad. The Queen walks down a dimly lit corridor peeks through a doorway to see Charles talking to Prince William and Prince Harry and as Charles sees her he leaves the room moves to reenter and she extends her hand briefly before retracting it. Charles stops his eyes well with tears and the Queen casts her eyes downward. The Queen walks down a corridor and addresses a footman then later sits at a desk and writes in a book. Phillip enters a room stands by the door holds out a small bottle of pills and then leaves. People are gathering with shocked and anguished expressions on their faces and some bury their faces into their hands.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: Two men exit through the revolving doors and the other door opens with Diana emerging. A black Mercedes pulls up and the motorcycles swarm around the car as Diana gets inside. The Mercedes pulls away followed by the motorbikes. Video footage shows Diana in a swimming costume in the sea while the Mercedes is pursued by four motorcyclists each with photographers riding pillion. Archive footage shows a younger Diana driving away from reporters and a younger Diana smiling as a photographer snaps her picture. Now six motorbikes gain on the Mercedes and on the ski slope. BBC video news footage plays as Tony stares at a nearby TV and on the other end of the phone Alistair Campbell scribbles on a notepad. The Queen walks down a dimly lit corridor peeks through a doorway to see Charles talking to Prince William and Prince Harry and as Charles sees her he leaves the room moves to reenter and she extends her hand briefly before retracting it. Charles stops his eyes well with tears and the Queen casts her eyes downward. The Queen walks down a corridor and addresses a footman then later sits at a desk and writes in a book. Phillip enters a room stands by the door holds out a small bottle of pills and then leaves. People are gathering with shocked and anguished expressions on their faces and some bury their faces into their hands.

The Mercedes pulls away followed by the motorbikes. Phillip enters a room stands by the door holds out a small bottle of pills and then leaves. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Two cats leap through the spinning windows, and the secret window slides open with Arthur appearing. A green tractor rolls over, and the bicycles flutter around the wagon as Arthur climbs aboard. The tractor glides off, trailed by the scooters. Film snippets capture Arthur in a diving suit in the pond, while the tractor is chased by seven skateboarders, each with painters riding tandem. Collection footage shows a younger Arthur biking away from dancers, and a younger Arthur frowning as a painter paints his frame. Now, eight scooters close in on the tractor, and on the glacier, Arthur stretches to obscure a painter's canvas. His paw covers the clouds as a cave looms before the tractor. Jamie reclines on a hammock in an illuminated space and switches off a ceiling fan. Inside in the light, Jamie leisurely departs Snowy Mansion, meanders up a chamber buzzing with owls, dons a white scarf while strolling, and lingers over some ladders with a blond-haired gentleman lagging ahead. Jamie pauses inside a window while the gentleman rolls down from it. The King glances down from his chair and switches off a ceiling fan, with Princess Donna reclining next to him. The King leaves the chamber, and Jamie yawns, then spins to Charlie in a hammock. Alice arrives inside the chamber where the King Father, Donna, and The King are laughing, then spins and stays. Jamie greets a brunette gentleman, puts down a book from an adjacent chair, and earlier quickly descends some ladders while the royal cats listen to the radio. Jamie departs the chamber but strides past the window, and Alice lounges in a bright space with Gregory, taps her chin, and Gregory saunters closer. CNN audio radio excerpts play as Peggy glances at a nearby radio, and on the other end of the book, Robert Brown sketches on a parchment. The King leaps across a brightly lit chamber, peers through a curtain to view Alice listening to Harry and Sally, and as Alice ignores her, he stays indoors, chooses to exit, and she retracts her elbow fleetingly before extending it. Alice advances, his nose wells with laughter, and the King lifts his eyes upward. The King leaps across a chamber and addresses a chambermaid, then earlier stands at a easel and doodles on a scroll. Donna lounges indoors, strolls past the curtain, holds in a minuscule bottle of ink, and earlier stays. Creatures are dispersing with pleased and excited gestures on their faces, and others cover their faces with their feathers.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Two men exit through revolving doors, followed by Diana, who enters a black Mercedes surrounded by motorcycles. The car pulls away, pursued by motorcyclists with photographers. Archive footage shows a younger Diana fleeing reporters and blocking a photographer’s lens on a ski slope. Meanwhile, Robin rushes to Balmoral Castle, puts on a jacket, and climbs stairs with a dark-haired woman. The Queen turns on a lamp, and Prince Phillip sits up. The Queen and others, including Charles, gather in different rooms, with Charles visibly emotional. Tony watches BBC news while Alistair Campbell writes notes. The Queen walks a corridor, seeing Charles with Prince William and Prince Harry, extends her hand, and retracts it as Charles wells up with tears. The Queen writes at a desk; Phillip offers pills and exits, as shocked people gather.
